item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, October 4, 2024 at 11:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Experimental web browser optimized for rabbit-holing (190 points | 46 comments)
2. Why does man print "gimme gimme gimme" at 00:30? (2017) (443 points | 172 comments)
3. Reverse Engineering and Dismantling Kekz Headphones (31 points | discuss)
4. Robert Dennard, DRAM Pioneer, has died (262 points | 21 comments)
5. Were RNNs all we needed? (374 points | 170 comments)
6. Patent troll Sable pays up, dedicates all its patents to the public (1058 points | 326 comments)
7. Canvas is a new way to write and code with ChatGPT (795 points | 568 comments)
8. The Silk Road (2023) (27 points | 4 comments)
9. Why and how we’re migrating many of our servers from Linux to the BSDs (190 points | 101 comments)
10. EU top court sides with activist Schrems in privacy dispute with Meta (16 points | 1 comment)
11. MikroPhone: A privacy enhanced, simple and featured RISC-V mobile phone (148 points | 45 comments)
12. The Unraveling of Space-Time (73 points | 51 comments)
13. France's 31-year treasure hunt for a buried owl statue ends (8 points | discuss)
14. Perfctl: A Stealthy Malware Targeting Linux Servers (54 points | 16 comments)
15. The Heart of Unix (2018) (127 points | 62 comments)

21. Dance training superior to physical exercise in inducing brain plasticity (2018) (269 points | 147 comments)
22. Holocron is an object storage based leader election library (5 points | discuss)
23. HTTrack Website Copier (81 points | 17 comments)
24. Mux (YC W16) is hiring a video engineer ( | hide)
25. Improving Accessibility Using Vision Models (49 points | 11 comments)
26. 159 employees are leaving Automattic as CEO’s fight with WP Engine escalates (116 points | 114 comments)
27. Determinism in League of Legends: Implementation (2017) (104 points | 46 comments)
28. Sequencing wastewater may be key to getting a grip on the H5N1 bird flu outbreak (44 points | 15 comments)
29. Serving 70B-scale LLMs efficiently on low-resource edge devices [pdf] (227 points | 55 comments)
30. Correcting the record for Continue and PearAI (102 points | 77 comments)
